Description: Lower body sherd of Corinthian(?) black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: at top left corner, trace of undeterimed motif (possibly a foot), above a brown-fired band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of front-facing panther (head, shoulder, and part of foreleg remaining) to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 230, no. 162)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 123, no. 346.5 pl. XXXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.202) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4808 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
